page.title: 02Churches
page.content: There are three churches in Reepham.The unique thing about Reepham churches is that they are all in the same churchyard.In the 16th century Hackford church was ruined and now only a portion of the wall remains. St. Michaels,Whitwell,is nearest the market place.It has a good 14th century tower,with finely proportioned buttresses and a delicately traceried parapet.The interior has little of interest and is used for meetings.The chancel of St. Michaels joins on to the s.w. corner of St. Marys,Reepham ,and there is a connecting door of St. Marys has connecting elaborate 15th century iornwork, and by the door is a fine set of James 1 Royal Arms in carved relief.In the centre of the chancle is a large brass mounument to Sir William de Kerdiston and his wife.The brass of him has lost one and
